abstract.p: Hudson River Valley Ramble, set to begin September 23, will include more than 60 events; drawing (By the Way column) (S)

block.p: Each journey, over 3,000 miles of trails in 10 counties, will begin with the proverbial single step. Some will also require a reservation.

So it's not too early to start making plans for the Hudson River Valley Ramble on Sept. 23 and 24. The ramble will include more than 60 events; terrain and trail type will vary, as will the difficulty of the hikes. The event is sponsored by the Hudson River Valley National Heritage Area, which extends from the George Washington Bridge 160 miles north to the Albany area.

A brochure describing all the weekend events is available from High Land Flings, which organized the ramble. Phone: (800) 453-6665.
